value.title: Russia reports highest daily rise in coronavirus cases; Singapore prepares to ease partial lockdown
value.excerpt: Russia's coronavirus crisis response center reported 9,623 new confirmed cases of Covid-19 on Saturday, its highest daily figure to date.

images.title: Russia reports highest daily rise in coronavirus cases; Singapore prepares to ease partial lockdown

value.title: South Korea's Tracking Of COVID-19 Patients Raises Privacy Concerns
value.excerpt: South Korea's use of personal data to trace coronavirus infections has inadvertently led to the stigmatization of some patients.

images.title: South Korea's Tracking Of COVID-19 Patients Raises Privacy Concerns

value.title: Harbin city shuts eateries, coronavirus curbs ease elsewhere in China
value.excerpt: A northeastern Chinese city of 10 million people struggling with currently the country's biggest coronavirus cluster shut dine-in services on Saturday, as the rest of China eases restrictions designed to hamper the spread of the disease.

value.title: Japan's PM to hold news conference on Monday about coronavirus
value.excerpt: Japan's Prime Minister Shinzo Abe will hold a news conference on Monday at 0900 GMT about the coronavirus, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs said on Saturday.

images.title: Japan's PM to hold news conference on Monday about coronavirus

value.title: After Pearl Harbor, our museum hid Asian art. In coronavirus crisis, we're showing it off.
value.excerpt: In 1941, our Japanese collection was rushed into storage and a Japanese employee was ushered into exile. Today, our art is an antidote to xenophobia.

images.title: After Pearl Harbor, our museum hid Asian art. In coronavirus crisis, we're showing it off.

value.title: Iran Coronavirus Deaths Rise by 65 to 6,156

value.title: Coronavirus: Shanghai Professor Helped World, "Next Day China Shut His Lab", Says White House
value.excerpt: The White House on Friday said China "mishandled the situation" after the coronavirus outbreak in its Wuhan city, but refrained from giving a definitive answer on retaliatory measures against the Asian giant.

images.title: Coronavirus: Shanghai Professor Helped World, "Next Day China Shut His Lab", Says White House

value.title: Singapore to ease some coronavirus curbs over next few weeks
value.excerpt: Singapore will start easing some curbs put in place to contain the spread of the coronavirus over the next few weeks, authorities said on Saturday, as the city-state takes the first tentative steps towards reopening its economy.

images.title: Singapore to ease some coronavirus curbs over next few weeks

value.title: Singapore confirms 447 new coronavirus cases, smallest rise in 2 wks
value.excerpt: Singapore's health ministry on Saturday confirmed 447 new coronavirus infections, the smallest daily rise in two weeks, taking the city-state's tally of cases to 17,548 with 16 virus-related deaths.

images.title: Singapore confirms 447 new coronavirus cases, smallest rise in 2 wks

value.title: ‘Shanghai professor let out info on COVID-19, next day China shut his lab,’ say White House
value.excerpt: President Donald Trump had hinted at using tariff as a tool to punish China for mishandling the virus outbreak.

value.title: China's Hubei reports no increase in COVID-19 cases for 28 consecutive days

value.title: How China uses its massive surveillance apparatus to track its citizens, keep them in line
value.excerpt: China has amassed a vast collection of information about its people in recent years as the Chinese Communist Party continues to deploy its surveillance apparatus to exercise control over its 1.4 billion inhabitants at the expense of privacy.

images.title: How China uses its massive surveillance apparatus to track its citizens, keep them in line

value.title: Almost Twice as Many Republicans See China as Enemy of the State Since Coronavirus Outbreak, New Poll Says
value.excerpt: China is viewed as an "enemy" of the United States by 27 percent of all Americans, including 42 percent of Republicans and 17 percent of Democrats, according to a new poll.

images.title: Almost Twice as Many Republicans See China as Enemy of the State Since Coronavirus Outbreak, New Poll Says

value.title: Coronavirus: Trump stands by China lab origin theory for virus
value.excerpt: Earlier the US national intelligence director's office said it was still investigating how the virus began. But the office said it had determined Covid-19 "was not manmade or genetically modified". China has rejected the lab theory and criticised the US response to Covid-19.

images.title: Coronavirus: Trump stands by China lab origin theory for virus

value.title: Coronavirus: The foster dad home-schooling 10 North Korean boys
value.excerpt: But one man in Seoul has a particularly tough task. Kim Tae-hoon, 45, homes 10 North Korean boys who defected from the repressive state without their parents. The youngest is just 10 years old, the oldest 22.

images.title: Coronavirus: The foster dad home-schooling 10 North Korean boys

value.title: Gods in face masks: India's folk artists take on Covid-19
value.excerpt: Working during the lockdown, which has now lasted more than a month, a group of folk artists and craftspeople across India have produced these illustrations and paintings in traditional styles. "Though many fear the impact of Covid-19 may be the end of craftspeople,

images.title: Gods in face masks: India's folk artists take on Covid-19

value.title: Singapore Confirms 932 New COVID-19 Cases, Death Toll Rises to 16
value.excerpt: Among the new cases, five are Singaporeans or permanent residents, while 905 cases are foreign workers living in dormitories, the health ministry said.

value.title: Can the unmasking of China’s Covid-19 ‘mask diplomacy’ stem Beijing’s global power grab?
value.excerpt: The Covid-19 outbreak found China uniquely positioned for a global soft power grab with its “mask diplomacy” supply of medical equipment. But then a drip of anti-Beijing headlines followed by an aggressive diplomatic onslaught unravelled the gains.

images.title: Can the unmasking of China’s Covid-19 ‘mask diplomacy’ stem Beijing’s global power grab?

value.title: Colorado Purchased 100K COVID-19 Tests From South Korea and 'Kept It Under Wraps' to Avoid Feds Seizure, Says Governor
value.excerpt: Colorado Governor Jared Polis said that the state did not announce a recent shipment of coronavirus test kits because "we simply didn't know if anybody would swoop in" and take the shipment.

value.title: Trump threatens new tariffs on China in retaliation for coronavirus
value.excerpt: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Thursday his hard-fought trade deal with China was now of secondary importance to the coronavirus pandemic and he threatened new tariffs on Beijing, as his administration crafted retaliatory measures over the outbreak.

images.title: Trump threatens new tariffs on China in retaliation for coronavirus

value.title: US, China Step Up Activities in South China Sea Amid COVID-19 Pandemic
value.excerpt: An old geopolitical hotspot is poised to boil again amid the coronavirus pandemic, with U.S. and Chinese warships stepping up their presence in the South China Sea.  “This week the United States conducted two successful freedom of navigation operations in the South China Sea.

images.title: US, China Step Up Activities in South China Sea Amid COVID-19 Pandemic

value.title: Hong Kong Protesters, Police Clash Again After Lull Brought by Coronavirus
value.excerpt: Riot police used pepper spray to clear demonstrators from a shopping mall, the first confrontation in months as the city’s antigovernment movement sought to revive protests after a break during the coronavirus pandemic.

images.title: Hong Kong Protesters, Police Clash Again After Lull Brought by Coronavirus

value.excerpt: More than 70 scholars urge leaders in Washington and Beijing to put partisan interests aside and coordinate their responses to Covid-19.

value.title: Anxiety about prejudice during coronavirus remains for Asian-American leaders in New York City

value.title: For coronavirus patients with diabetes, blood sugar control is key, China study reveals
value.excerpt: People with Type 2 diabetes are at greater risk of a poor outcome if they become infected with the novel coronavirus -- and controlling blood sugar levels is especially key if they do, a new study revealed.

images.title: For coronavirus patients with diabetes, blood sugar control is key, China study reveals

value.title: Meet Pepper and Whiz: Japan debuts robots at hotels to look after coronavirus patients
value.excerpt: The hotels are also staffed by doctors and nurses, but officials hope the robots can cheer up patients who are isolated in single rooms.

images.title: Meet Pepper and Whiz: Japan debuts robots at hotels to look after coronavirus patients
